description: Minimal exponent in prime factorization of n.
links: Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Niven's Constant
maple: a := proc (n) if n = 1 then 0 else min(seq(op(2, op(j, op(2, ifactors(n)))), j = 1 .. nops(op(2, ifactors(n))))) end if end proc: seq(a(n), n = 1 .. 100); # _Emeric Deutsch_, May 20 2015
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, 0, Min @@ Last /@ FactorInteger[n]], {n, 100}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Jan 24 2006 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051904 1 = 0a051904 n = minimum $ a124010_row n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 15 2012(PARI) a(n)=vecmin(factor(n)[,2]) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 19 2012
author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 16 1999
